intro: Lysipomia cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the cylindrical leaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Lysipomia cylindrocarpa is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
